meanings.definition: The belief in the unity of God as opposed to the doctrine of the Trinity.
meanings.sent1: Unitarianism teaches that God is one and not three.
meanings.sent2: Many people follow unitarianism because they believe in the oneness of God.
meanings.sent3: At the unitarian picnic, they joked that God must have a hard time deciding what to wear with only one wardrobe.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of unitarianism, the flowers of unity bloom brightly.
meanings.sent5: The concept of unitarianism is like a single thread weaving through the fabric of faith.

meanings.definition: A religious movement that emphasizes the oneness of God and rejects the divinity of Jesus.
meanings.sent1: Unitarianism promotes the idea that God is singular and Jesus is not divine.
meanings.sent2: People who practice unitarianism do not believe in the divinity of Jesus.
meanings.sent3: During the unitarian talent show, someone joked that Jesus must have been a terrible carpenter if he couldn't make a divine table.
meanings.sent4: The unity in unitarianism stands firm like a lighthouse in the stormy sea of beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The essence of unitarianism is like a clear sky with only one shining star.
